item.title: Resident Evil 5 Voice Actor Hints at Possible 30th Anniversary Announcement
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil 5’s voice actor is teasing a new announcement coming this March, during the franchise’s 30th Anniversary.

Capcom’s next big title, Resident Evil Requiem, arrives next month on February 27, 2026. The developers just provided us with another trailer, showcasing Leon Kennedy’s gameplay in the process. However, after this title, what’s next for the franchise might be revealed during the 30th Anniversary event in March.

Resident Evil 5’s Sheva Alomar Teasing Something for March 2026

Spotted on r/GamingLeaksAndRumours, the voice actor for Karen Dyer from Resident Evil 5, Sheva Alomar, has posted a cryptic video on their official X account (formerly Twitter). The video’s caption states that “got a few fun things lined up for March. Stay Tuned!. Additionally, the video itself has another caption that reads “When you know something, but can’t share it with the world…yet.”

Fans from the community have already started making all kinds of speculation from this post, with many hoping that this could be a tease for a possible Resident Evil 5 Remake. At the same time, there are also speculations that Alomar will star in another Resident Evil movie, with Resident Evil: Death Island’s writer, Makoto Fukami, mentioning in a 2023 Fangoria interview that he would “love to bring back characters like Barry Burton or Sheva Alomar.”

Additionally, there was a claim from last year that stated Resident Evil 5 Remake was not in development. Whatever this announcement is, players will have to wait until Resident Evil’s 30th Anniversary to know for sure, and all players are hoping that more games are announced this year.

In other news, PlayStation was recently seen promoting a strange Resident Evil rip-off, ‘Ebola Village‘. Additionally, Requiem’s director has stated that the upcoming title is “almost like having two games“. What do you think Resident Evil 5’s voice actor is teasing for this March? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Hytale adding dinosaurs, changes to mining sounds, and more in the next patch. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass—Price, Rewards, & Is It Worth It?
item.content:encoded:
A new season has arrived in Marvel Rivals, headlined by the addition of Deadpool, and there’s a new Battle Pass to consider purchasing in Season 6.

Battle Passes in Marvel Rivals include a wide array of cosmetic rewards, and Insider Gaming has the breakdown of everything included in the Season 6 pass, alongside the price and a verdict of whether it’s worth buying.

How Much is the Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass?

The Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass is priced at 990 Lattice, which equates to around $9.99, but there are other options available.

For 2100 Lattice, you receive an immediate 2800 Chrono Tokens to unlock rewards and receive an additional 20% Chrono Tokens Acquisition bonus for the duration of the season to increase the amount you earn for each quest completed.

You can purchase the Battle Pass through currency earned in-game, and, once unlocked, it’s permanently available, so you can work through it at your own pace.

All Rewards in Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass

The Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass has 12 pages stacked with rewards, including costumes that can’t be obtained anywhere else, two of which are included in the free pass.

Without splashing out on the pass, a free costume is available for Storm and Blade, while purchasing the pass unlocks rewards for the likes of Venom, Winter Soldier, Invisible Woman, and Mantis.

For a full breakdown of all the rewards in the Season 6 Battle Pass, take a look at the table below.

Is the Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass Worth it?

Unfortunately, the Season 6 Battle Pass in Marvel Rivals is arguably the weakest to be introduced since launch, and, unless you’re in love with one of the premium skins, it’s an easy one to skip.

The characters featured, including Venom, Wolverine, Winter Soldier, and Invisible Woman, all have better costumes already available in the game, so it’s hard to justify splashing out on the pass.

Not having a Deadpool skin included is a major disappointment, considering how high the excitement levels have been for his addition, and you’d be better off saving your Lattice for a different purchase.

What do you think about the Marvel Rivals Season 6 Battle Pass? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals, take a look at all the Twitch Drop rewards for Season 6, and check out the latest buffs and nerfs.

item.title: Hytale is Adding Dinosaurs, Mining Sound Changes and More
item.content:encoded:
Hypixel Studios’ founder has confirmed that a new patch is coming with dinosaurs, changes to mining sounds, and more.

The founder had recently discussed being unhappy with mining in Hytale and asked for suggestions on how to make the process more satisfying, while outlining several other improvements coming to the game. It seems the first set of improvements to Hytale’s mining system should arrive tomorrow.

Hytale Founder Confirms New Patch While Revealing Hide Helm Option is Coming Next Week

A player on X recently tagged the Hypixel Studios founder on X (formerly Twitter) about the issues their avatar’s hair is facing due to the game’s headgear. Simon was quick to respond to the player, revealing that a “hide helm” option is arriving next week, which will fix their issue.

In the same thread, he also revealed that a patch for Hytale is coming tomorrow that will add dinosaurs to Z4 underground, change mining sounds, allow placing torches in dual wield, and more. The patch will also include some fixes; however, details about them were not revealed.

Hytale’s developers have been hard at work to constantly improve the title while it is in early access. The developers just released a hotfix today, which addresses several connectivity and stability concerns.

If you are new to Hytale, check out Insider Gaming’s guide on how to repair weapons, tools, armor, and other essentials in Hytale. Also, here’s a guide to the details and types of Workbenches in Hytale, including how to unlock and craft them all.

Moreover, check out Insider Gaming’s first impressions on the game: “Move over Minecraft, there’s a new king in town.” What are your thoughts on Hytale’s next patch adding dinosaurs, mining sound changes, and more to the game? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Embark Studios teasing ‘multiple maps’ coming to ARC Raiders this year. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Hytale Hotfix Addresses Connectivity and Stability Issues
item.content:encoded:
Hytale developers are back again with a new hotfix, this time addressing connectivity and stability issues.

Hypixel Studios’ new sandbox RPG seems to be off to a great start in early access, with even Riot Games, the studio that previously cancelled the game, congratulating them on the successful release. The developers are hard at work to constantly improve the game and have recently released a hotfix to address several concerns.

Hytale January 15 Hotfix Details

As revealed on their blog, Hytale’s new hotfix addresses connectivity and stability issues. The game has now received general server stability and network improvements in the new update. After updating, the game switches to offline mode if authentication fails; it used to get stuck before. The last connectivity fix addressed the “invalid token” errors that appeared when the player’s system clock was slightly out of sync.

Regarding stability improvements, client performance has improved through optimization of background task scheduling. Additionally, issues with dropped items getting stuck inside blocks and server crashes in certain situations have been fixed. Interested readers can check out the changes from the previous hotfix here.

In other news, check out Insider Gaming’s first impressions on Hytale, with our Josh Challies predicting that he is “highly unlikely to ever play Minecraft again.” Additionally, Hytale’s founder is unhappy with the game’s mining and has outlined ‘thousands’ of improvements coming to the title. Has the latest Hytale hotfix resolved the issues that you were facing? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the LEGO The Legend of Zelda: The Final Battle – Ocarina of Time set leaking ahead of the official reveal. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: MTG Fallout Secret Lair ‘Rad Superdrop’ Revealed and Coming Soon
item.content:encoded:
Magic: The Gathering is preparing to expand on the Fallout collaboration that was released in 2024 with an all-new Secret Lair drop. The Secret Lair website was recently updated with a new banner that reveals the crossover as coming soon, but instead of focusing on the games, the ‘Rad Superdrop’ will be linked wholeheartedly to the Fallout television series.

Many of the cards were revealed early on, uncovering a stack of premium prints, including Lucy MacLean, The Ghoul, Maximus, the Platinum Chip, and Mindcrank, which was the first card to be unveiled.

Fallout’s Magic Secret Lair Range Coming Soon

The Secret Lair range, which sits under the Magic banner, has featured some of the most beloved franchises in gaming and pop culture. The likes of The Last of Us, Uncharted, Avatar, God of War, Horizon, and Ghost of Tsushima have all found a home in the Secret Lair brand, which is described as:

…the party inside the party at Magic: The Gathering. We combine everything we love about Magic with the stuff in pop culture that inspires us. Each drop puts a brand-new spin on your favorite cards and might even have something entirely new.

The Fallout MTG Secret Lair line is the next big entrant into that universe, and it’s coming soon.

Secret Lair and Magic confirmed that the Fallout Rad Superdrop line will go live on January 26, exclusively on the Secret Lair site.

There’s also something special for the diehard fans willing to part ways with a hefty amount of cash – the Secret Lair x Fallout Silver Shroud Costume promo card, only available once you’ve spent at least $149 USD.

At the heart of the Fallout Secret Lair pack sits the Beyond Vault 33 centrepiece. This includes the entire line-up of the Fallout TV show characters, imagined in a range of settings and outfits. That’s especially true for Lucy MacLean, arguably the lead of the Fallout show above The Ghoul and Maximus, who is shown in the many outfits she has worn as the show has unravelled.

It doesn’t end there, though – many sub-sets make up the Secret Lair x Fallout drop:

  • Secret Lair x Fallout: Greet the Dog
  • Secret Lair x Fallout: Rad
  • Secret Lair x Fallout: Welcome to New Vegas

For each pack, foil prices will be between $39.99 and $49.99, while non-foil prices will be from $29.99 to $39.99.

Wizards of the Coast has advised that stock is likely to sell out very fast, especially given the hype around Fallout as the second season of the show unravels and the game franchise remains extremely popular.

Are you planning to pick up any of the MTG Fallout Secret Lair drops? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that the Fallout Shelter casting call has gone live

Grant's passion for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC when he wasn't even old enough to walk properly. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with an undying love for the…
